ThingDef.label: Mosin-Nagant M91-30
ThingDef.description: USSR. The Mosin-Nagant M91-30 was the backbone of the Red Army during WWII.

ThingDef.label: SVT 40
ThingDef.description: USSR. A semi-automatic rifle put in service to replace the Mosin-Nagant bolt-action rifle but never able to do so.

ThingDef.label: Mosin-Nagant M91-30 scoped
ThingDef.description: USSR. The Mosin-Nagant M91-30 was the backbone of the Red Army during WWII. Extremely precise, it made famous a lot of soviet snipers.

ThingDef.label: SVD Dragunov
ThingDef.description: USSR. A semi-automatic sniper rifle, in the right hands, it's death itself.

ThingDef.label: AKM
ThingDef.description: USSR. Do I really need to tell you what it is ??

ThingDef.label: AKMS
ThingDef.description: USSR. Do I really need to tell you what it is ?? This time with a bit more steel and a bit less wood.

ThingDef.label: SKS
ThingDef.description: USSR. A carbine semi-auto only, fire the same ammunition than the AK 47.

ThingDef.label: SKS with bayonet
ThingDef.description: USSR. A carbine semi-auto only, fire the same ammunition than the AK 47.

ThingDef.label: DP 27
ThingDef.description: USSR. The DP 27 is a drum-fed LMG, medium rate of fire.

ThingDef.label: RPD
ThingDef.description: USSR. The precursor of the concept of Squad Automatic Weapon, the RPD has a pretty high rate of fire, it fires the same munition than the AK 47.

ThingDef.label: PM MAT 49 converted 7.62×25mm TT
ThingDef.description: Vietnam. A converted version of the French SMG to fire the soviet 7.62×25mm TT bullet. It gave it a higher rate of fire.

ThingDef.label: PPSH 41
ThingDef.description: USSR. The PPSH 41 is the first widespread SMG made by the soviets. With its high rate of fire and its drum mag, you will be able to mow down fascists for the Motherland !

ThingDef.label: PPS 43
ThingDef.description: USSR. The PPS 43 was meant to replace the more expensive and complicated to make PPSH 41. Lower rate of fire that make it more controlable.

ThingDef.label: K50M
ThingDef.description: USSR. A foreign copy of the PPS 43.

ThingDef.label: PPSH 41 (stick mag)
ThingDef.description: USSR. The PPSH 41 is the first widespread SMG made by the soviets. With its high rate of fire, you will be able to mow down fascists for the Motherland ! But be careful that it has a 30 rounds magazin so even though it's lighter you cannot spray'n pray like with 71 rounds one.

ThingDef.label: TT-33
ThingDef.description: USSR. The Tokarev TT-33 is a semi-automatic pistol carried by officers and tank crews.

ThingDef.label: RPG-2
ThingDef.description: Eastern Block. The RPG-2 is a simple tube that allow to fire a Rocket-propelled anti-tank grenade, however it's also useful againt infantry and their cover.
